connect-repositories-provider.title: Connect your code repositories provider
connect-repositories-provider.message: Let Symeo analyse your code, commits and pull requests is the fastest way to measure and improve your DevOps performance.
connect-repositories-provider.security-message: You're in control of your data: we do not copy or store your code on our end.

create-teams.title: Congratulations! You just created the {organizationName} organization
create-teams.subtitle: Now, organize your repositories into teams
create-teams.message: Splitting your repositories into specific teams is the best way to get relevant insights.

errors.empty-name: You must provide a name for your team
errors.empty-repositories: You must provide at least one repo to your team

coding.title: Coding
coding.tooltip: Computed as the time between the first and the last commit (before any pull request event).

review.title: Review
review.tooltip: Computed as the time between the last commit and the approval of the pull request.

deploy.title: Deployment
deploy.tooltip-branch: Computed as the time between the pull request approval and the moment the branch commits arrive on the production branch with pattern "{branchPattern}".
deploy.tooltip-tags: Computed as the time between the pull request approval and the moment the branch commits are pushed on a tag matching "{tagsPattern}".

testing.configure-message: your testing integration to send and display data.

configuration.title: Configure testing data integration
configuration.message: Add the following command to your Continuous Integration configuration to be run after the generation of your code coverage report (do this for all the repository of the team):

parameters.api-key: The Symeo api key associated to your organization.
parameters.coverage-report-path: The path to your coverage report in xml format
parameters.coverage-report-type: Your coverage report provider (jacoco, istanbul currently supported)
parameters.unit-test-file-pattern: The wildcard pattern corresponding to all your unit testing files
parameters.integration-test-file-pattern: The wildcard pattern corresponding to all your integration testing files
parameters.code-file-pattern: The wildcard pattern corresponding to your production code (all your code except tests)
parameters.test-framework: The test framework you use (jUnit, jest currently supported)
parameters.repository-name: The name of the repository for which data are sent
parameters.branch-name: The name of the branch for which data are sent
parameters.commit-sha: The current commit hash for which data are sent

errors.empty: You must provide at least one email to invite

remove-dialog.title: Removing a member from {organizationName}
remove-dialog.message: User with email {email} will be removed

remove-dialog.title: Removing an API key from {organizationName}
remove-dialog.message: API key {teamName} will be removed, you won't be able to use it to send data anymore

create-dialog.title: Create API key for {organizationName}
create-dialog.value-field-helper: Copy and save this value (you won't be able to get it once you close this dialog)

releases-detection.title: Releases detection
releases-detection.message: Select the way you would like Symeo to detect releases.

branch.title: Detect my releases by Pull Requests to a dedicated branch
branch.message: Please specify a regular expression to identify your release branch

tags.title: Detect my releases using tags
tags.message: Please specify a regular expression to identify your release tags

exclude-branches.title: Exclude branches
exclude-branches.message: If your work is done with feature branches you should add to this list all the branches that are not a target to a direct commit and used only as a baseline branch (e.g. Master, Staging, Development etc.)

team-goals-library.title: Choose a new goal for {teamName} team

empty-state.title: No Team Goals configured
empty-state.message: Set up a 'New Team Goal' to start improving your key indicators

value.mean-tooltip: Calculated over the last two weeks

confirm.title: Deleting Team Goal
confirm.message: Goal "{standardName}" will be removed from {teamName} team

time-to-merge.title: Aim for short PR lifecycle
time-to-merge.description: Pull requests that are open for a long time run the risk of being more difficult to merge, due to conflicts or forgotten context. They can also be the symptom of communication issues, too large PR or low PR quality.

page.title: Aim for short PR lifecycle - Settings

limit-config.title-before-input: A pull request should be merged in less than

dashboard.title: All PRs merged in less than {target, plural, =0 {day} one {# day} other {# days}}

pull-request-size.title: Avoid large pull request
pull-request-size.description: Itâ€™s easier for humans to work on smaller tasks. Small pull requests are easier to read, which increases the review quality and reduces the risk of errors.

limit-config.title-before-input: A pull request should not have more than

average.subtitle: Avg. number of lines per PR

regular-production-deployments.title: Aim for regular production deployments
regular-production-deployments.description: A high deployment frequency means delivering value to end users more quickly. Also, studies show that high-functioning teams have higher deployment frequency.

small-coding-tasks.title: Aim for small coding tasks
small-coding-tasks.description: Splitting tasks into small units means getting technical and functional feedback quicker. This allows detection of defective technical strategies or misunderstood specifications early on.

strong-test-coverage.title: Aim for strong test coverage
strong-test-coverage.description: Code coverage measures the effectiveness of your tests. Higher code coverage increases your chances of finding bugs and reduces the risk and cost of refactoring.

short-deployment-time.title: Aim for short deployment time
short-deployment-time.description: Having a fast deployment pipeline means you get quicker feedback on deployment problems. It also reduces the cost of deployment and allows you to deploy more often.

pull-requests-table.title: Team Pull Requests
pull-requests-table.empty-message: No pull requests for the selected time period

cycle-time-piece-table.title: Pull Requests cycle time values
cycle-time-piece-table.empty-message: No pull requests for the selected time period

data-status.loading: Symeo is performing the initial processing of your data. Graphs will be displayed shortly.
